verses.verse: Let Israel rejoice in their Maker; Let the children of Zion be joyful in their (Ps. 33:3) King.
(Judg. 8:23; Zech. 9:9; Matt. 21:5) Let them praise His name with the dance; Let them sing praises to Him with the timbrel and harp.
For (Ex. 15:20; Ps. 81:2) the LORD takes pleasure in His people; (Ps. 35:27) He will beautify the humble with salvation.
Let the saints be joyful in glory; Let them (Ps. 132:16; Is. 61:3) sing aloud on their beds.
Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, And (Job 35:10) a two-edged sword in their hand,
To execute vengeance on the nations, And punishments on the peoples;
To bind their kings with chains, And their nobles with fetters of iron;
(Heb. 4:12; Rev. 1:16) To execute on them the written judgment— (Deut. 7:1, 2; Ezek. 28:26) This honor have all His saints. Praise the LORD!
(Let All Things Praise the LORD) Praise (Ps. 148:14; 1 Cor. 6:2) the LORD! Praise God in His sanctuary; Praise Him in His mighty firmament!
Praise Him for His mighty acts; Praise Him according to His excellent (Ps. 145:5, 6) greatness!
Praise Him with the sound of the trumpet; Praise Him with the lute and harp!
Praise Him with the timbrel and dance; Praise Him with stringed instruments and flutes!
Praise Him with loud cymbals; Praise Him with clashing cymbals!
Let everything that has breath praise the LORD. Praise the LORD!
(The Beginning of Knowledge) The (1 Kin. 4:32; Prov. 10:1; 25:1; Eccl. 12:9) proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:
To know wisdom and instruction, To perceive the words of understanding,
To receive the instruction of wisdom, Justice, judgment, and equity;
To give prudence to the (Prov. 9:4) simple, To the young man knowledge and discretion—
(Prov. 9:9) A wise man will hear and increase learning, And a man of understanding will attain wise counsel,
To understand a proverb and an enigma, The words of the wise and their (Num. 12:8; Ps. 78:2; Dan. 8:23) riddles.
(Job 28:28; Ps. 111:10; Prov. 9:10; 15:33; (Eccl. 12:13)) The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge, But fools despise wisdom and instruction.
(Shun Evil Counsel) (Prov. 4:1) My son, hear the instruction of your father, And do not forsake the law of your mother;
For they will be a (Prov. 3:22) graceful ornament on your head, And chains about your neck.
My son, if sinners entice you, (Gen. 39:7-10; Deut. 13:8; Ps. 50:18; (Eph. 5:11)) Do not consent.
If they say, “Come with us, Let us (Prov. 12:6; Jer. 5:26) lie in wait to shed blood; Let us lurk secretly for the innocent without cause;
Let us swallow them alive like Sheol, And whole, (Ps. 28:1) like those who go down to the Pit;
We shall find all kinds of precious possessions, We shall fill our houses with spoil;
Cast in your lot among us, Let us all have one purse”—
My son, (Ps. 1:1; Prov. 4:14) do not walk in the way with them, (Ps. 119:101) Keep your foot from their path;
(Prov. 6:17, 18; (Is. 59:7); Rom. 3:15) For their feet run to evil, And they make haste to shed blood.
Surely, in vain the net is spread In the sight of any bird;
But they lie in wait for their own blood, They lurk secretly for their own lives.
(Prov. 15:27; (1 Tim. 6:10)) So are the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain; It takes away the life of its owners.
